entries.title: The GOP-led House was set to approve a spending package late Wednesday that reopens the government after a record-length shutdown
Here are key parts of the shutdown deal, from back pay to hemp regulation and a controversial item involving potential $500,000 payouts to senators

Democratic members of the House Oversight Committee on Wednesday released new emails from Jeffrey Epstein in which he discussed Donald Trump, pushing the issue of their relationship back into the spotlight
FBI Director Kash Patel had a whirlwind week during the government shutdown, including a trip on the bureau jet to the ‘Boondoggle Ranch’ in Texas.
The Trump administration is poised to unveil a plan that would allow oil drilling off the California coast
The Supreme Court on Tuesday said the Trump administration could continue for now to withhold funds to pay the full amount of federal food-assistance benefits for November
Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer wasn’t one of the eight Democratic senators who voted to back GOP legislation to end the government shutdown. He is still taking most of the blame.
The Republican-led Senate late Monday passed a spending package to end the government shutdown, with Democrats providing enough votes to move the measure across the finish line
The decision by eight members of the Senate Democratic caucus to side with Republicans to advance a bill to end the government shutdown reopened divisions within the Democratic Party
Trump threatened to dock the pay of air-traffic controllers who don’t return to work, as flight cancellations and delays spread across the country because of the government shutdown
What has Trump done as president so far? The Wall Street Journal is tracking his biggest moves to reshape the federal government. See the full list.
U.S. elections are sending a consistent message: Americans are deeply frustrated with their government’s inability to solve problems
Middle-class voters, many of them frustrated with MAGA and President Trump, could be up for grabs in next year’s midterms
Senate Republicans have tried to persuade their vulnerable Georgia colleague Jon Ossoff to join them in voting to reopen the government, to no avail
Republican Rep. Elise Stefanik, an ally of President Trump, announced a run for New York governor in next year’s election, challenging Democratic incumbent Gov. Kathy Hochul
In Charts: In Virginia and New Jersey gubernatorial elections, the working-class, Hispanic and Black neighborhoods that helped return Trump to the White House moved back to Democrats
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said that the Pentagon will shake up the way it buys weaponry, equipment and software by making purchases more quickly—and from a broader range of potential suppliers.

The Trump administration is still deciding whether to push Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro out of power or extract concessions from him, according to U.S. officials familiar with the deliberations
The Trump administration believes it can continue its lethal military campaign against alleged drug-running boats without congressional authorization
SpaceX is set to receive $2 billion to develop satellites that can track missiles and aircraft under President Trump’s Golden Dome project
A day after President Trump vowed to resume testing of nuclear weapons, the White House wasn’t answering questions about the details, leaving experts and insiders uncertain what he meant
